abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Avian Influenza
            Control and Human Influenza Emergency Preparedness and
            Control Project for Haiti is to minimize the threat posed to
            humans by highly-pathogenic avian influenza (HPAI) infection
            and other zoonoses, and to prepare for, control, and respond
            to influenza pandemics and other infectious disease
            emergencies in humans. Objective indicators do not change
            but the targets are modified because the base line has
            changed, as well as the depth of activities to be conducted
            with the reallocation of proceeds for the strengthening of
            the Ministry of Agriculture, Natural Resources and Rural
            Development (MARNDR). Particularly the following targets
            will change in the objective indicators of the project: (i)
            one third (instead of half) of communal sections will send
            weekly reports on time; and (ii) 1500 (instead of 2800)
            backyard poultry farmers currently applying at least three
            prescriptions to protect their poultry and/or family of
            Avian Influenza diseases. The reallocation is based on: (i)
            the need to strengthen animal and human health activities;
            and (ii) the need to replace equipment and materials damaged
            by the earthquake at the Central Bio-safety Laboratory in
            Port au Prince.
